Checkbox.title: Checkbox
Checkbox.desc: Checkboxes allow users to select multiple options from a list or turn an item/feature on or off. Checkboxes are often used in forms, settings, and selections in lists.

Badge.title: Badge
Badge.desc: Badges convey dynamic, temporary information, such as counts or status. A badge can include labels or numbers.

ðŸŸ¢ Progress Bar.title: ðŸŸ¢ Progress Bar
ðŸŸ¢ Progress Bar.desc: The progress bar is used to visually represent the completion of a both determinate and indeterminate task. It is used to  show how much of the task has been completed and how much is  left.

ðŸŸ¢ Tab.title: ðŸŸ¢ Tab
ðŸŸ¢ Tab.desc: Tabs are a navigational component used to organize and navigate between different sections of content.

Avatar.title: Avatar
Avatar.desc: Avatars are visual representations of users that leverage images, icons, or text. They also can contain a presence indicator which shows the userâ€™s status on the product.

ðŸŸ¢ Stepper (redo-tables).title: ðŸŸ¢ Stepper (redo-tables)
ðŸŸ¢ Stepper (redo-tables).desc: Steppers is a visual representation of a userâ€™s progress through a set of steps. Each of the steps are guiding toward the completion of a specified process or a task.

Templates.title: Templates
Templates.desc: Brief description about the guideline. User or reference the description text that exists under Overview of the documentation

Select (Dev Review).title: Select  (Dev Review)
Select (Dev Review).desc: Selects present a list of options from which a user can select one option, or several. A selected option can represent a value in a form, or can be used as an action to filter or sort existing content.

Toast (Comp Review).title: Toast (Comp Review)
Toast (Comp Review).desc: The Toast component is a non-intrusive message display element used to deliver brief and important notifications to users.

Chip (Migrate Review).title: Chip (Migrate Review)
Chip (Migrate Review).desc: Chips are used to show added items within a form, make selections, filter content, or trigger interaction. These items can be valid or invalid.

List (Component review).title: List (Component review)
List (Component review).desc: The list component is a UI element that displays a list of selectable options for the user. It can contain a variety of other components like images, avatars, controls, icons, or multiple lines of text.

Search (Migration Review).title: Search (Migration Review)
Search (Migration Review).desc: Search offers users a way to explore a website or application using keywords. Search can be used as the primary means of discovering content or as a filter to aid the user in finding content.

Grid & Layout.title: Grid & Layout
Grid & Layout.desc: The Grid is an overarching guide to the placement of components and elements. Aligning to the grid ensures consistency, visual balance and rhythm.

Illustration Guideline.title: Illustration Guideline
Illustration Guideline.desc: We simplify complex ideas with our unique illustrations, making them universally clear and memorable, while allowing our brand personality to evolve unexpectedly.

AX Guideline.title: AX Guideline
AX Guideline.desc: Accessibility is the inclusive practice of ensuring that everyone has equal access to information, functionality, and experiences.
